title.narrative: Burkina Faso - Bagre Growth Pole Project

description.narrative: To increase private investment, employment generation and agricultural production in the Project Area.The assumption is that increased economic activity will be a result of both improved infrastructure for irrigation contributing to more successful agriculture (financed mainly under the original project) and increased private investments in the BagrÃ© region incentivized by rehabilitated feeder roads, access to electricity and water supply, and increased opportunities for SMEs and targeted investment promotion activities. All of the above are covered by project activities. A further assumption is that increased economic activity in the BagrÃ© region will lead to increased job creation in the area and that the labor intensity of the supported agribusiness activities is relatively high.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Economy, Finance and Development

condition.narrative: FA, Schedule 2, Section 1.F, Inundation Risks Study, Revised Due Date: November 30, 2018

Finance Agreement :Dam Inspection.Schedule 2, Section I, F,1(b) of the FA. | Description :Under an agreement between theRecipient, BagrÃ©pÃ´le, and NEC (â€œNew BagrÃ© Dam Management Agreementâ€?), ensure that BagrÃ©pÃ´le carries out a safetyinspection of the BagrÃ© Dam at intervals of not less than once every 2 years during the implementation of the project, byindependent experts whose ToR, qualifications, and exp shall be satisfactory to IDA (1st safety inspection 8/30/2018; 2nd8/30/2020) | Due Date :30-Aug-2018

Finance Agreement :Land Rights Review. Schedule 2, Section I, E,4(a) of the FA. | Description :Recipient to carry out, under termsof reference acceptable to the Association, and furnish to the Association, a study to: (a) identify all persons displaced oradversely affected by the irrigation activities of this project; (b) confirm the implementation of compensation (including land)provided to such persons ... adverse effects; (c) determine... (d) recommend measures... (e) ensure adequacy | Due Date:30-Nov-2018

Finance Agreement :MOB PA, Schedule, Section I.A | Description :MOB shall employ private operators for the following activities:planning, design, construction, management, maintenance and critical services. | Due Date :30-Jun-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I, F, 1(a) of the FA. | Description :Recipient to carry out study related to dam safety orto cause Bagrepole to (a) carry out a study of risks of inundation... water from Bagre Dam; (b) prepare an updated operation andmaintenance plan... the results of the study in (a); (c) furnish study in (a) to the Association for review; (d) adopt... (e)establish... (f) carry out...referenced in (d). Recipient must engage dam safety specialist | Due Date :30-Nov-2018

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 | Description :The Recipient shall maintain the Steering Committee throughout theProject, to provide strategic directions for and policy guidancefor the Project; the SC shall meet once every semester. | Frequency:Yearly
Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 | Description :The Recipient shall restructure MOB based on terms of referenceacceptable to the Association. | Due Date :31-May-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.D; MEBF/MOB PA, Schedule, Section I.C | Description :Recipient shall prepare prior to eachcalendar semester a Semi-annual Work Program of activities for inclusion in the Project during the following semester. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E | Description :Recipient shall carry out study to ident. persons displ. by dam andirrigation, confirm compensat. provided to them, det. if outstanding grievances, recom. measures and ensure land tenure arrangs |Due Date :30-Nov-2018

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.E; MEBF/MOB PA, Schedule, Section I.D | Description :Recipient shall ensure that noactivities in Semi-annual Work Program requiring EA, EMP or RAP be implem. unless requ. EA/EM has been prep., discl. and appr., andRAP measures taken. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Section 4.01 | Description :Any party to Subsidiary Agreement, Safeguard Implementation Agreement or BagrE DamManagement Agreement has failed to perform any of its obligations under the relevant agreement. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (a), Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 | Description :The Recipient has adopted the Project ImplementationManual. | Due Date :01-Dec-2011

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (b); Schedule 2, Sections I.B and I.E | Description :Subsidiary Agreements between Recipient andMEBF and MOB, and Safeguard Implementation Agreement among Recipient, MEBF and MOB havebeen executed on behalf of the parties torelevant agreement. | Due Date :31-Oct-2011
Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (c) | Description :BagrE Dam Management Agreement between Recipient and SONABEL has been executedon behalf of the parties to the agreement. | Due Date :01-Dec-2011

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (d) | Description :MOB has Project Management team with general man., production man., financialman., invest. prom. man., operations man., procurement spec., M&E expert, env. spec. and soc. and land spec. | Due Date:31-Oct-2011
Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 (e) | Description :MEBF has recruited an additional procurement specialist. | Due Date :31-Oct-2011
MEBF shall make Matching Grants and cash transfers to Beneficiaries for Sub-projects on standard terms and conditions, and inaccordance with key Project-specific criteria and procedures. |
